Key Match Events: Juan Soto misplayed several balls in right field during the Yankees' 14-7 loss to the Cardinals.
Brendan Donovan's fly ball, which had an expected batting average of .090, got by Soto for a double that led to a run.
Lars Nootbaar's decisive three-run double eluded Soto on a play he could have made.
Post-Match Reflections: Juan Soto commented on his misplays, attributing one to the wind and backspin on the ball.
Aaron Boone mentioned that he didn't believe Soto should have caught one of the misplayed balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees pitching staff is expected to get key additions with Luis Gil and Clarke Schmidt returning from rehab assignments.
Scott Effross and Ron Marinaccio were recalled from Triple-A, with Effross struggling in his return.
